CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 10, 1953, page 29, reads: "Extra Sales Push... was given the Lucky Strike Cigarette advertising campaign in courier when special posters were distributed throughout the nation calling special attention to the current attractive ads featured in this publication. The national campaign is of particular interest as it ties in with the World Series and features endorsements of leading Dodger ball stars. Pictured above, commenting on the Lucky Strike display, are, left to right: Walter Jones, Pittsburgh Lucky representative; William Goode, owner of Goode Pharmacies; Clyde Page, Courier promotion manager, and John Edghill, Lucky Strike sales supervisor for the Eastern Seaboard area. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Walt Jones, Pharmacist William W. Goode, Jim Goode or possibly Clyde Page, and Clyde Page or possibly John Edghill, standing at counter in Goode Pharmacy with advertisement for Lucky Strike cigarettes listing Roy Campanella, Joe Black, and Junior Gilliam, another version
